Database.Title: Cancer Treatment Database
Database.Notes: This database contains information relating to treatments for cancer and their effectiveness. The data is organized around particular treatments and the responses they generated.

Entity.name: Drug
Entity.Notes: A drug is a compound used in treatments, for example [b]picoplatin[/i]. The ID is the name of the drug.

Field.name: description
Field.Notes: text describing the drug, often a URL to a web site

Entity.name: Treatment
Entity.Notes: A treatment is a therapeutic regimen, normally a set of drugs, dosages, and dosage intervals. The ID is a unique but meaningful name. For example, distinct FOLFOX treatments (varying dosages or intervals) must be given precise names like [i]FOLFOX-1[/i] and [i]FOLFOX-2[/i].

Field.name: description
Field.Notes: text describing the treatment, often a URL to an appropriate web site

Entity.name: ExpValues
Entity.Notes: An instance of this entity represents a sample or experiment, stored as gene expression values. The values may reflect a microarray experiment from any microarray platform or RNA-seq data. It may be thought of as an R dataframe capturing a set of expression values. The ID is a unique code string.

Field.name: normalized-values
Field.Notes: an encoded R dataframe, including an [b]id[/b], which must match the ID of this entity instance, an [b]outcome[/b] from a controlled ontology, and a set of 2-tuples [b](spot-id, normalized expression level)[/b]

Field.name: raw-values
Field.Notes: a string encoding the raw values, including the probe IDs and their associated values

Field.name: type
Field.Notes: a code indicating the meaning of the gene presence/absence and expression values, (e.g. [i]genomic[/i], [i]primary-tumor[/i], [i]tumor[/i], [i]metastasized-tumor[/i])

Entity.name: Source
Entity.Notes: A source of DNA or RNA. It can be an actual patient or a cell line. The ID is a unique code string.

Field.name: type
Field.Notes: the type of source-- [i]patient[/i] or [i]cell line[/i]

Field.name: gender
Field.Notes: the gender of the source-- [b]M[/b] (male), [b]F[/b] (female) or space (not known or relevant)

Field.name: age
Field.Notes: the age of the source in years, or 0 if it is not known or relevant

Entity.name: Response
Entity.Notes: A category which describes an outcome for a treatment. The ID is a unique code string.

Field.name: description
Field.Notes: text description of the meaning of this particular response code

Entity.name: Result
Entity.Notes: A [i]result[/i] is a specific response to a specific treatment performed on a specific source. In essence, it is a ternary relationship which yields the results of a treatment. The ID is an automatically assigned sequence number.

Entity.name: CancerType
Entity.Notes: A category of cancer, used to organize the data during queries. The ID is a string abbreviation for the cancer type.

Field.name: name
Field.Notes: full name of the specified cancer type

Entity.name: Study
Entity.Notes: A study involves giving treatments to a set of sources and gathering expression-values to determine what happened.

Relationship.name: Drug2Treatment
Relationship.Notes: This relationship connects a drug to a treatment in which it participates, and contains information about how the drug is used in the treatment. Provision is made for the possibility that the drug is not given in constant dosages at regular intervals.

Field.name: frequency
Field.Notes: the mean dosage frequency, in doses per day

Field.name: description
Field.Notes: a detailed description of how the drug is given, in what amounts, and how often

Relationship.name: Study2ExpValues
Relationship.Notes: This relationship connects a study to the results of an experiment used by the study.

Relationship.name: Study2CancerType
Relationship.Notes: This relationship connects a study to the types of cancer being studied.

Relationship.name: CancerType2Source
Relationship.Notes: This relationship connects a source to the types of cancer diagnosed in the source.

Relationship.name: Source2ExpValues
Relationship.Notes: This relationship connects an experimental result (expression values) to the source on which the experiment was performed.

Relationship.name: Source2Result
Relationship.Notes: This relationship connects a treatment result to the source on which the treatment was performed.

Relationship.name: Treatment2Result
Relationship.Notes: This relationship connects a treatment result to the treatment that produced it.

Relationship.name: Response2Result
Relationship.Notes: This relationship connects a treatment result to the response code representing the effect of the treatment.

Relationship.name: CancerType2Result
Relationship.Notes: This relationship connects a treatment result to the type of cancer that was being treated.
